title: Eating at a lower trophic level requires less land

content.question: Vegetarianism is often cited as a partial solution to the growing problem of deforestation and other types of habitat destruction as the human population continues to grow. The reason for this is

choices.label: vegetarians are healthier due to a lack of animal fat in their diets
more people can be fed using less agricultural land because vegetarians eat at a lower trophic level
vegetarians consume fewer calories per person and therefore require fewer acres of farmland
vegetarian diets often recommend consuming large amounts of tree nuts as a source of protein, which preserves forest habitats
vegetarians often support conservation efforts that promote forest conservation

content.answer: more people can be fed using less agricultural land because vegetarians eat at a lower trophic level
